biz.paluch.spinach.api

Interface DisqueConnection<K,V>

  • Type Parameters:
    K - Key type.
    V - Value type.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DisqueAsyncConnectionImpl

    public interface DisqueConnection<K,V>
    A thread-safe connection to a redis server. Multiple threads may share one DisqueConnection. A ConnectionWatchdog monitors each connection and reconnects automatically until close() is called. All pending commands will be (re)sent after successful reconnection.
    Since:
    24.06.15 07:29
    Author:
    Mark Paluch

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Returns the DisqueAsyncCommands API for the current connection.

    • Method Detail

      • sync

        DisqueCommands<K,V> sync()
        Returns the DisqueCommands API for the current connection. Does not create a new connection.
        Returns:
        the synchronous API for the underlying connection.

      • async

        DisqueAsyncCommands<K,V> async()
        Returns the DisqueAsyncCommands API for the current connection. Does not create a new connection.
        Returns:
        the asynchronous API for the underlying connection.

      • setTimeout

        void setTimeout(long timeout,
                TimeUnit unit)
        Set the default command timeout for this connection.
        Parameters:
        timeout - Command timeout.
        unit - Unit of time for the timeout.

      • getTimeoutUnit

        TimeUnit getTimeoutUnit()
        Returns:
        the timeout unit.

      • getTimeout

        long getTimeout()
        Returns:
        the timeout.

      • dispatch

        <T> com.lambdaworks.redis.protocol.RedisCommand<K,V,T> dispatch(com.lambdaworks.redis.protocol.RedisCommand<K,V,T> command)
        Dispatch a command. Write a command on the channel. The command may be changed/wrapped during write and the written instance is returned after the call.
        Type Parameters:
        T - result type
        Parameters:
        command - the redis command
        Returns:
        the written redis command

      • close

        void close()
        Close the connection. The connection will become not usable anymore as soon as this method was called.

      • isOpen

        boolean isOpen()
        Returns:
        true if the connection is open (connected and not closed).

      • getOptions

        com.lambdaworks.redis.ClientOptions getOptions()
        Returns:
        the client options valid for this connection.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Reset the command state. Queued commands will be canceled and the internal state will be reset. This is useful when the internal state machine gets out of sync with the connection.
